repnme.cdata!:
Ethiopia - Public Sector Capacity Building
            Program Support Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Public Sector Capacity
            Building Program Support Project for Ethiopia were as
            follows: outcomes were satisfactory; risk to development
            outcome was moderate; bank performance was satisfactory; and
            borrower performance also satisfactory. Some of the lessons
            learned included: invest time and effort in alignment and
            securing political support, engage more with support to
            sub-national governments where the bulk of service delivery
            takes place, the 'learning by doing' approach was
            a pragmatic approach to reforms, enforcing 'minimum
            mandatory activities' in framework type projects,
            context matters - customizing reform according to context,
            realism of supervision budgets, have a simple and
            implementable strategy for information, education and
            communication, complex design, multiple sectors and
            implementing agencies as well as multiple donors make
            implementation support and monitoring very challenging.

repnme.cdata!:
Ethiopia - Public Sector Capacity Building
            Program Support Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Public Sector
            Capacity Building Program Support Project is to improve the
            scale, efficiency, and responsiveness of public service
            delivery at the federal, regional and local level; to
            empower citizens to participate more effectively in shaping
            their own development and to promote good governance and
            accountability. The reallocation is necessary to meet actual
            projects needs during implementation and do not involve any
            new changes to the original project description, objectives
            or associated outcomes as well as use of cost of project
            savings. In summary, the team considers the reallocation to
            be a minor one because there is no change in the project
            description, development objectives, and targets. In
            addition the main beneficiaries of the
            nationally-administered systems are principally the regions.
            The total amount that government seeks to reallocate is
            equivalent to US$10 million.

display_title.display_title:
Ethiopia - Public Sector Capacity
            Building Program Support Project : restructuring : Main report
